Luckily, your current residence is the top floor of the tall building, with nothing to provide sunlight but the stain-glass window; better still, the top floor is occupied only by Fantina (that is to say, you), which gives you a rare opportunity to practice manipulating your two female bodies without fear of being caught. You're now able to operate Fantina and your mother in a way that looks completely natural and uncoordinated. What could make this go any better, you ask? You've recently discovered that being inside a host's body for long enough gives you full access to their mind -i.e. their memories, skills, mannerisms, et cetera, et cetera- enabling you to impersonate them perfectly, as well as giving you a finer degree of control over their body. (As a delightfully unexpected side-effect of sharing Fantina’s mind, you can also speak French, her native language, quite fluently now).

You briefly toy with the idea of going out and looking for yourself, but quickly brush it aside as the doors finally open, and you note with relief and delight that it's your body that strides proudly into the room; he looks a bit worse for wear from the battles he no doubt endured, but you know you’d stocked up on enough potions to last to make it through.

"Fantina!" Your body declares confidently, pointing a finger "I'm here to beat you and earn the Relic Badge!"

"C'est magnifique!" You exclaim in her native tongue with delight, just like the real Fantina would, gracefully spinning towards your end of the field on one foot before stopping to strike a pose. "It appears I have yet another challenger, filled with spirit! Very well, I accept your challenge!”

Your body grins confidently, and eagerly reaches towards his belt...

“But first!”

He freezes. Your eyes have a mixture of curiosity and impatience as your body gives Fantina’s a questioning look, clearly not that happy with being delayed from a battle any longer.

“What do you say to a little, ah, deal, mes ami?” you suggest, elaborating when your body’s expression shifts from impatience to curiosity. “If you win, I give you the Relic Badge, but If I win, you must do me a très petit faveur à mon goût. Sounds good, no?” Your body appears to think for a few seconds before a grin splits its face, and you know you’ve won.

“Alright, you’re on!”

“Fantastique!” you exclaim happily, clapping your gloved hands together with a smile, though you’re smirking on the inside. “But I’m not one to give up the Relic Badge easily!”

“And I’m not one to lose so easily,” your body retorts confidently. “Now let’s do this!”

“Oui, let’s battle!”

“So what did you want me to do with this thing again?” your body asks as it looks at the Poketch you’ve given it dubiously, clearly still a bit unhappy with the defeat it just suffered. It wasn’t that hard, really; with the Fantina’s prowess and your knowledge of how you yourself think, you beat your original self with ease, even with the new pokemon it’s managed to catch. As you thought with a bit of self-deprecation and disappointment with yourself, the smarter decision would have been to head to Jubilife City first and work your way from Gardenia up. Fantina’s persona, however, was very impressed by your body’s spirit, and you praised yourself on it after the battle was over.

All in all, everything’s worked out just as you planned.

“I want you to put zis watch on, press zis button, and then say into it, ‘Maylene’. Très simple, no?” you repeat your instructions in Fantina’s heavy French accent.

Your body looks still looks unsure, but you the kind of person to keep promises, so with a shrug, it obeys. “Maylene,” it says into the device, pressing the button as you instructed.

On cue, you feel the strange sensation that comes before the division of your consciousness. Your mother, who you are still sitting on the couch, again feels next to nothing. Inside Fantina, however, you feel yourself getting dizzy and a bit nauseous, and you feel yourself tipping. Fortunately, Fantina didn’t get the reputation of being a soulful dancer for nothing, and her body quickly steadies itself on instinct. From an outside perspective, it would look like Fantina merely leaned forward for a second or two.

The feeling subsides shortly afterwards, and then you are laying on the ground, gazing up at the blue sky with your hands folded behind your head as a makeshift pillow. You blink, then sit your new body up. Before you do anything that might be you keep Maylene still while you have Fantina send your body away, inviting it to come back when it’s stronger. Once Fantina’s alone again, you allow yourself to inspect your new body, bringing yourself to your feet with a perfectly-executed rising handspring.You’re amazed how easily you could perform feats of athleticism and skill that your own body wasn’t capable of.

Maylene’s body is one you’re unused to, possessing a musculature different than both Fantina’s and your own. Maylene is shorter than your other two bodies, but years of intense training in the martial arts has gifted her with strong, hard muscles that leave her with little fat while retaining her slim, petite figure; it gives her body an entirely different feeling than the slender and graceful and comely dancer’s body that Fantina has.

You look down to inspect your new acquisition: Maylene is wearing a pair of loose white pants that fit snugly on your hips, with a single thick, pink stripe on each leg; a blue and black leotard covers your torso, and your hands are covered by protective, blue and pink fingerless gloves. You wiggle your toes, enjoying the feeling of the grass under Maylene’s bare feet. You check your wrist; as expected, the poketch resides there unassumingly. You punch the air a few times, and are pleasantly surprised at how pleasant and natural it feels to this body. Then you’re reminded of your discovery shortly after your possession of Fantina, and you concentrate, reaching deep into Maylene’s persona, where streams of knowledge flow around you like fish. You reach out, and touch one. Then, all at once, information explodes into your mind, and you let out a cry of pain.

The involuntary absorption of Fantina’s mind had been such a subtle and painless process that you’d barely noticed what was happening until it was over, and the Gym Leader’s mind had been fully assimilated into yours. Now that you’re forcefully trying to accelerate the process with Maylene, however, it’s significantly different; whereas Fantina’s mind had been a gentle, almost imperceptible stream, Maylene’s was a tsunami, and you’re fighting just to stay abreast of the massive amount of information blasting itself into your mind.

Your vision swims. You fall -all three of you- to your knees, clutching your skull. Every breath you take is an effort, and your entire body feels like it’s on fire. The pain is more intense than anything you’ve ever felt before, and every moment seems to last an eternity. And then, it’s over. Everything around you comes back into focus. The pain in your head leaves as quickly as it came, vanishing without a trace. “Well, there’s something I won’t try again ever...” you remark to yourself, looking around. How long did that take anyway? You look down at your Poketch. Your eyes widen; the whole ordeal had lasted less than thirty seconds! “Holy crud!” you exclaim. Unbelievable. You’ll have to remember never to do that again.

As it turns out, you did, as a quick perusal through your mind confirms, indeed absorb Maylene’s mind. Her memories and personality are yours to animate, just as Fantina’s.

However, being the upstanding young hero that you were, your conscience immediately began to bug you. Steve's actions had hurt you, but this forest wasn't on the general map of Sinnoh; he could get lost. Shaking your head, and wishing that you had a more aloof personality, you darted off after him.

One hundred meters into the trees, the forest was still thin enough to see the path. One of the vents from the Underground opened up right where you went in, and so long as it remained in sight you could easily return with or without a map. Cupping Dawn's hand to your mouth, you called for Steve, making all sorts of halfhearted apologies. The owner of your borrowed body would not be pleased when her traveling partner inexplicably threw accusations at her.

Against your better judgement, you went further into the forest. The cone-topped vent could just barely be seen through a hole in a bush. The undergrowth of the forest, which consisted mainly of thick shrubs and the occasional vicious briar, grew thicker. You wished Dawn would put on more clothing, for your thighs were gaining more small scrapes by the minute.

Suddenly, a crackle prompted your senses to high alert. A jagged arc of electric energy blazed past your head. One of your now slender hands reached instinctively to your waist to grab one of Dawn's Pokemon; however, you found nothing. Apparently Dawn was such a mold-breaker in terms of fashion that she was above keeping her pokeballs in a convenient place. You began to pat yourself frantically for a means of defening yourself from the attack as you had done so many other times in the field, but a thin green mist clouded your vision. An extremely out of character curse escaped Dawn's lips, and you fell dead asleep, the victim of an untimely Sleep Powder.

When you awakened, you found yourself in a grassy clearing. Your back was against a large tree. A mass of sticky white silk made moving your torso impossible, and your head couldn't move far either, courtesy of Dawn's outrageously long hair getting stuck in the String Shot. You yawned, and began to look around for help, making sure to keep your cool. Pokemon could be territorial, but most wouldn't attack and kill a human, unless ordered to by another human. You looked around for a while, and spotted a Caterpie directly above you on the tree trunk. As soon as you spotted it, it scurried back up the tree and out one of its many limbs. <Human! Our tribe's stockpile has been ransacked, and we find you rummaging around shouting for someone!> A high, squealy voice sounded.
